application.Audio

Class WaveFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.Audio.WaveFile

  • public class WaveFile
extends java.lang.Object
    Class responsible for analyzing a .wav file.
    Taken from this stackoverflow question, and modified to fit my use.
    Author:
    Artem Novikov, Spud

      • WaveFile

        public WaveFile(java.io.File file)
         throws javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException,
                java.io.IOException
        Constructor for WaveFile.
        Parameters:
        file - - the .wav file.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException - Thrown if the file is not supported.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown due to some IO error. I dunno, never encountered this error in testing ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

      • getSampleInt

        public int getSampleInt(int sampleNumber)
        Returns sample (amplitude value).
        Note that in case of stereo samples go one after another. I.e. 0 - first sample of left channel, 1 - first sample of the right channel, 2 - second sample of the left channel, 3 - second sample of the right channel, etc.
        Parameters:
        sampleNumber - - The sample number
        Returns:
        int - The sample.
